EmailTemplate.textOnly:
ENS International Participant Email
Dear {!Contact.FirstName},
'Get more of what you want'
Here is some important information for the ENSI Consultant Development Program–Facilitator (CDP-F) you are attending on {!Contact.Job_Certificate_Date__c}.
Venue Days 1-4 {!Contact.Job_Venue_Name__c} {!Contact.Job_Venue_Address__c}, {!Contact.Job_Venue_City__c}, {!Contact.Job_Venue_Country__c}
Day 5 ENS office Level 5, 83 York street, Sydney
Timing Currently we are planning to work from {!Contact.Job_Start_Finish_Time__c}. Of course, this is subject to negotiation.
You should schedule around 1 to 1.5 hours each evening for assignments in preparation for the following day. The atmosphere of the workshop will be informal and you will be more than welcome to wear casual dress.
Pre-Program Requirements
1. Program Focus Questionnaire 'PFQ'- The PFQ helps the program leader to customise the program based on your needs. We ask that all PFQs are completed by {!Contact.Job_PFQ_Due_Date__c}. Click here to access the questionnaire. http://www.surveygizmo.com/s3/1125122/CDP-PFQ?pfq-rait&rait=NO&jid={!Contact.Last_Job_ID__c}&pid={!Contact.Last_Participant_Id__c}
Note: This link is specific to you, please don't forward to others.
2. Negotiating and Influencing Profile ‘NIP’ - the NIP is a profile covering 20 key competencies relating to the negotiation and influencing capabilities of individuals. You will receive a separate email with instructions to log on and complete the NIP online. This should take approximately 20 minutes. We ask that all NIPs are completed by {!Contact.Job_NIP_Due_Date__c}.
Pre-Reading Prior to the CDP-F, will you please read the ENS green manual ‘Professional Negotiation & Influencing’ and ensure you are capable of making quick reference by page number to the ENS content.
Please advise me if you don't already have a copy of the ENS manual.
Program Outline Focusing on workshop facilitation of the ENS negotiation and influencing methodology, topics typically covered during this CDP-F workshop include:
Adult learning and skills development Systematic consideration of the ENS philosophy & materials Needs assessment of participants and organizations Program design for specific situations Best practice faciliation and team-teaching techniques Experiential learning methods, including active role reversal Managing the learning environment Classroom control Handling the unexpected Individual tuition and supervised practice Generate strategic options Personal critiquing and evaluation of individual presentations
On Day 5 of the workshop we will also be scheduling a session on ENSI marketing and office administrative procedures.
Program Materials At the commencement of the workshop, you will receive your personal copy of the ENSI Workshop Leader’s Guide. Additional materials and ENSI participant texts will also be circulated during the workshop.
Lunch will be provided and there will be suitable breaks during the workshop to enable participants to communicate with business colleagues and clients. Please advise if you have any special dietary requirements.
If you require accommodation, please let me know and we can recommend some hotels close to the venue.
Should you have any questions, please feel free to contact me.
Kind regards,
{!Contact.Job_CSM_Name__c} {!Contact.Job_CSC_Title__c}
ENS International - Level 5, 83 York Street, Sydney 2000, NSW, Australia Phone: +61 2 9299 9688
